title.narrative: OUTP 2.4: HIV IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Emergency-affected children, adolescents and pregnant and breastfeeding women living with or without disability have enhanced access to critical HIV services and information., which contributes to Hiv Prevention, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2: By 2020, at least 80 per cent of children, pregnant women and adolescent girls and boys have equitable use of proven HIV prevention and treatment interventions

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND CHILD CARE

sector.narrative: HIV - Emergency preparedness and response including Post exposure prophylaxis and risk informed conflict sensitive HIV programming
HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Emergency-affected children, adolescents and pregnant and breastfeeding women living with or without disability have enhancedaccess to critical HIV services and information.

description.narrative: Close to 77,000 women and children were supported and reached by UNICEF with information via community volunteers and media on HIV prevention, care and treatment in 25 disaster affected districts. In addition, 42,000 pregnant and breastfeeding women as well as children and adolescents living with HIV received HIV treatment and prevention of mother to child transmission services. This was achieved through integration of HIV into COVID response and overall emergency preparedness and implementation plans. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
